segment.source: Release Notes for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0
segment.target: Release Notes for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0

segment.source: Release Notes for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0
segment.target: Release Notes for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0

segment.source: Release Notes for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0
segment.target: Release Notes for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0

segment.source: October 2009
segment.target: October 2009

segment.source: About Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0
segment.target: About Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0

segment.source: Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) 4.0 extends the capabilities of the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
segment.target: Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) 4.0 extends the capabilities of the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).

segment.source: AGPM provides comprehensive change control and improved management of Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
segment.target: AGPM provides comprehensive change control and improved management of Group Policy Objects (GPOs).

segment.source: The following documents can help you get started with AGPM 4.0.
segment.target: The following documents can help you get started with AGPM 4.0.

segment.source: For an overview of the capabilities of AGPM, see Overview of Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=162671).
segment.target: For an overview of the capabilities of AGPM, see Overview of Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=162671).

segment.source: For information about how AGPM 4.0 differs from AGPM 3.0, see What's New in AGPM 4.0 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160058).
segment.target: For information about how AGPM 4.0 differs from AGPM 3.0, see What's New in AGPM 4.0 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=160058).

segment.source: For guidance about how to determine whether AGPM 4.0, AGPM 3.0, or AGPM 2.5 is appropriate for your environment, see Choosing Which Version of AGPM to Install (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=145981).
segment.target: For guidance about how to determine whether AGPM 4.0, AGPM 3.0, or AGPM 2.5 is appropriate for your environment, see Choosing Which Version of AGPM to Install (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=145981).

segment.source: For basic guidance about how to install AGPM and a sample scenario for using AGPM, see Step-by-Step Guide for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=153505).
segment.target: For basic guidance about how to install AGPM and a sample scenario for using AGPM, see Step-by-Step Guide for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=153505).

segment.source: This guide is primarily designed to help evaluators and first-time users.
segment.target: This guide is primarily designed to help evaluators and first-time users.

segment.source: For information about how to upgrade from an earlier version of AGPM or detailed guidance about how to plan the deployment of AGPM in your organization, see the Planning Guide for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=156883).
segment.target: For information about how to upgrade from an earlier version of AGPM or detailed guidance about how to plan the deployment of AGPM in your organization, see the Planning Guide for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=156883).

segment.source: For information about how to use AGPM to perform specific tasks, see the Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 Help, which is also available on TechNet as the Operations Guide for AGPM 4.0 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=159872).
segment.target: For information about how to use AGPM to perform specific tasks, see the Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 Help, which is also available on TechNet as the Operations Guide for AGPM 4.0 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=159872).

segment.target: More information

segment.target: For more information about AGPM, see the following:

segment.source: Providing feedback
segment.target: Providing feedback

segment.source: You can post feedback or questions about AGPM to the Group Policy Forum (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=145532).
segment.target: You can post feedback or questions about AGPM to the Group Policy Forum (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=145532).

segment.source: Known issues with AGPM 4.0
segment.target: Known issues with AGPM 4.0

segment.source: Import from Production command does not import settings into a GPO that is checked out
segment.target: Import from Production command does not import settings into a GPO that is checked out

segment.source: If you edit a GPO in the production environment, you must import the GPO from production to update the GPO in the offline archive.
segment.target: If you edit a GPO in the production environment, you must import the GPO from production to update the GPO in the offline archive.

segment.source: The Import from Production command is intended to let you perform a final production backup before you finish editing so that you can roll back to the production backup if it is necessary.
segment.target: The Import from Production command is intended to let you perform a final production backup before you finish editing so that you can roll back to the production backup if it is necessary.

segment.source: If the GPO is checked out when you run the Import from Production command, then the production changes are not incorporated into the checked out version of the GPO.
segment.target: If the GPO is checked out when you run the Import from Production command, then the production changes are not incorporated into the checked out version of the GPO.

segment.source: However, the imported version of the GPO is added to the history of the GPO even though that version is not available to be edited.
segment.target: However, the imported version of the GPO is added to the history of the GPO even though that version is not available to be edited.

segment.source: When the GPO is checked in, that version will supersede the imported version in the archive, but both are available in the history of the GPO.
segment.target: When the GPO is checked in, that version will supersede the imported version in the archive, but both are available in the history of the GPO.

segment.source: Workaround: Make sure that the GPO is checked in before you import it from production.
segment.target: Workaround: Make sure that the GPO is checked in before you import it from production.

segment.source: If the GPO was not checked in before you imported it, you can use the Undo Check Out command to discard your changes and roll back to the version of the GPO that you imported from production.
segment.target: If the GPO was not checked in before you imported it, you can use the Undo Check Out command to discard your changes and roll back to the version of the GPO that you imported from production.

segment.source: Checked out GPOs cannot be edited for several minutes in an environment that uses a multiple site Active Directory topology
segment.target: Checked out GPOs cannot be edited for several minutes in an environment that uses a multiple site Active Directory topology

segment.source: AGPM uses a client/server model.
segment.target: AGPM uses a client/server model.

segment.source: The AGPM Server and the AGPM Client each determine their own closest domain controller for Group Policy operations.
segment.target: The AGPM Server and the AGPM Client each determine their own closest domain controller for Group Policy operations.

segment.source: When you check out a GPO by using an AGPM Client, it is actually the AGPM Server that checks the GPO out from the offline archive to a temporary folder in the SYSVOL folder.
segment.target: When you check out a GPO by using an AGPM Client, it is actually the AGPM Server that checks the GPO out from the offline archive to a temporary folder in the SYSVOL folder.

segment.source: If the AGPM Server and the AGPM Client are in different sites, then the temporary checked out GPO may not be present on the local site's domain controller for several minutes or up to 30 minutes due to SYSVOL replication latency.
segment.target: If the AGPM Server and the AGPM Client are in different sites, then the temporary checked out GPO may not be present on the local site's domain controller for several minutes or up to 30 minutes due to SYSVOL replication latency.

segment.source: In this situation, you cannot edit the checked out GPO using the GPMC on an AGPM Client until SYSVOL replication of the checked out GPO has occurred.
segment.target: In this situation, you cannot edit the checked out GPO using the GPMC on an AGPM Client until SYSVOL replication of the checked out GPO has occurred.

segment.source: Workaround: As a best practice, you should position AGPM Clients in the same site as the AGPM Server to which they connect so that you do not have to wait for SYSVOL replication to occur before you can edit a checked out GPO.
segment.target: Workaround: As a best practice, you should position AGPM Clients in the same site as the AGPM Server to which they connect so that you do not have to wait for SYSVOL replication to occur before you can edit a checked out GPO.

segment.source: AGPM cannot read the backup limit if your account does not have permissions for the archive
segment.target: AGPM cannot read the backup limit if your account does not have permissions for the archive

segment.source: On an AGPM Client, if you log on by using an account that has not been delegated permissions to the AGPM archive, start the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), and then click Change Control, you receive the following error.
segment.target: On an AGPM Client, if you log on by using an account that has not been delegated permissions to the AGPM archive, start the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), and then click Change Control, you receive the following error.

segment.source: Workaround: Contact an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) and request that they delegate access to AGPM for your account.
segment.target: Workaround: Contact an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) and request that they delegate access to AGPM for your account.

segment.source: If you are an AGPM Administrator, log on by using an account to which the AGPM Administrator role is assigned so that you can delegate access for the additional account.
segment.target: If you are an AGPM Administrator, log on by using an account to which the AGPM Administrator role is assigned so that you can delegate access for the additional account.

segment.source: For more information, see "Delegate Domain-Level Access to the Archive" in the AGPM Help.
segment.target: For more information, see "Delegate Domain-Level Access to the Archive" in the AGPM Help.
